Posts.Content: Samibvca wrote: I am new to all of this.  I was diagnosed in April, had a lumpectomy and will need 4 treatments of chemo (Cytoxin and Texotere) and radiation after that. I start chemo tomorrow.   I had a picc line inserted this morning and my arm is very sore at the entry point.  I've taken Ibuprofen and a left over Darvocet, as well as, ice but nothing is helping!  How on earth am I going to wear this thing for 3 mos.?  How am I going to sleep with it?  Even light pressure on it is painful.  I called the PA-C and he said if it hurts tomorrow I may need to have it removed and re-inserted.  I don't know what to do.  I asked if people just have it inserted each time they have chemo and he said he has done it in the past.  Since I only need 4 treatments is this the way to go?  I hate the thought of living with a tender arm for the next 3 months.  My oncologist said a mediport is unnecessary due to the number of treatments. Any help or advice will be appreciated. Thank you, Teresa  Dx 4/5/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Picc Line Hurts - Please Advise Samibvca vlnrph

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2011 03:10AM Samibvca wrote: Thanks everyone for your advice. It feels a little better today. When the nurse took the dressing it off there is a good size bruise there so that's probably all it is. Thanks again!
